title: Multimedia E-Learning Course for Systematic Interpretation of Chest X-Rays

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and Knowledge of Human Anatomy
context.additional_context: Non-real-time education optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, providing continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Analyze the anatomical structures of chest X-rays using a 4-step systematic approach (position/rotation, ribs/diaphragm, lung fields, mediastinum)
Accurately identify imaging findings of common chest diseases (pneumonia, pneumothorax, pleural effusion, etc.) with at least 85% accuracy
Improve self-reflective learning skills by correcting diagnostic errors at least twice using multimedia learning materials

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
